data.title: Kibbeh Nayii was outstanding
data.text: I recently stayed at the Westin Pasadena hotel for a business conference. Since the parking spots were tiny, once we parked we did not want to move our car. We chose the Eden Garden Bar & Grill because it was in walking distance to the hotel. I am so glad we did! We ordered the Kibbeh Nayii for appetizer and it was absolutely outstanding. We also ordered lamb kabobs, veggies, and pilaf and were not disappointed. The service was excellent, the drinks were stiff, and the prices were reasonable. Highly recommended.

user_location.name: Big Bear City, California, United States

data.title: Excellent dining experience
data.text: A terrific, delightful, and reasonably priced dining experience in the middle of everything, but located on a peaceful street.  The menu has several lamb selections and steaks at reasonable prices.  Very good house varietals at modest prices.  Excellent service from Abraham (member of the family of the owners). Be sure to dine in the full brick, large patio/garden area with the roll away roof, waterfalls, and lots of greenery for a very pleasant ambiance.  At nights there is pleasdant live entertainment which we did not stay for.

data.title: Food OK but it lacks something.
data.text: The food was ok even though it took a long time to get it and it was a good size and well cooked.  However, this place lacks something, I am not sure what it is.  Maybe the waiters aren't very welcoming.  Maybe it is the smell of the whole place, it smells a bit like a cellar or a closed room with old furniture.  Maybe it is the dark entrance.  The patio and the terrace could be a lot nicer if they took good care of the place.  It is not a place I will return for now even though it is well priced.

owner_response.author: EdenGardenBar, Owner at Eden Garden Bar & Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Ervaan,
I am so sorry and very disappointed to hear that you did not have a good experience. Our goal is to always provide the best and no less. If you could please let me know the day of your visit, so I can look into this further.

We always get great reviews since we took over recently as you may have read on yelp as far as Ambiance and food. So it has come as a surprise that the place and food were not to your pleasing and would love to hear more, so we can make the necessary corrections.

Regards,
Tarek
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great venue for event/party
data.text: We had our company holiday party today for lunch at the Eden Garden Bar & Grill for Kaiser.  Tania, the owner was a pleasure to work with, and her staff provided excellent service.  We had over 80 people in attendance and everyone loved the food and service.  This is a great place for an event/party.

data.title: I'm surprised by how few people are here
data.text: I was unaware of this restaurant and tried it.  Really great.  Very reasonable prices and great service. We had appetizers to share.  I was impressed be the menu and ambience.   I will return!

data.title: great food; inconsistent service
data.text:
I love the food here: very tasty, very reasonably priced, huge portions (I can usually make two extra meals). The service is friendly but not especially attentive. The three times I've dined there in the past two months, hardly any other diners are there, yet the service still lags.

Recommended dishes: mouhamara, hummus & lehmeh, chicken shawarma, falafel plate, salmon dinner.

data.title: NEVER AGAIN
data.text: nothing but a head ache and just full of disappointment. I have a company party planned there and I only go to the Glendora restaurant. I want to have an amazing time and thought .. hey why not try Pasadena? they have a full liquor license and it should be the same great service right?? WRONG!!! I was trying to book reservations since OCTOBER and after the 3rd try I finally get it on the books for DEC 6th. I have had people from my party call and the manager Shant? was nothing but rude to them. I confront the owner Edward and he gives me his WORD that everything will be taken care of and nothing will go wrong. THE VERY NEXT DAY I get a phone call at 9 P.M!!!! from Shant saying sorry but we double booked with the police department and now your pretty much s*^t out of luck. EXCUSE ME??!? I called the Glendora restaurant and Anthony was nothing but professional and took control of the situation. He was so professional and understanding. YOU Anthony will be the only reason I would go back! Edward shook hands with my Husband promising to clean up the situation and making promises that now he is saying he didn't say. really?!? DO NOT GO THERE! ONLY GO TO GLENDORA.

owner_response.author: EdenGardenBar, General Manager at Eden Garden Bar & Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Naomi,

I read your review and we are very disappointed of the bad experience you had in 2014. Eden Garden Pasadena is now under new Management and has been transformed. We appreciate reviews such as yours for us to take action and make the necessary changes. Fell free to visit us on Facebook and yelp to read more recent updates and reviews about the place for 2015 to date.

my name is Tarek, please feel free to call me at any time at the restaurant and would love to meet you and make things right for you this time and every time moving forward.

Again, our sincere apologies and look forward for a second chance under the new management.

Regards,
Tarek
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Service has Changed - for the worse
data.text: We have been to this restaurant many times; however, our recent dining experience will be our last. The service was beyond poor as we waited so long to be seated - the place was empty - and for each order taken. The waiters were not responsive and it seems like the management does not have control any more on the level of service and quality of food provided. It is a shame as we will not return here again.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text:
Excellent food and service 
Manager very friendly 
Hookah excellent .... one of best in 
Sunday night Arabic singer night 
I would go there again

data.title: Make up your mind!!!!
data.text: This is my third visit and last! My friend took me there on Sunday and there was a advertisement on table for happy hour and well the waiter said it was a mistake however would honor it and stated happy hour was Monday thru Friday. Now I go Friday with my husband and no happy hour the manager said he would honor it and yet friends showed up before 7 and were charged full price for appetizers that should of been half price.

data.title: Excellent Place
data.text: Eden Garden is a great place. The Meditterenean food is delicious and not as expensive as you would expect at a restuarant with such a nice atmosphere. As for the comments I read on this site about poor service or rude manager, I think that this place is so succesful that the customers who come in with an attitude can expect to get kicked out. Unfortunately some customers expect 5 star service everywhere they go but they have to understand that while theyre service is great they arent going to get treated like the king or queen. And you cant expect a waiter to show you special attention when the place is packed full unless you tip him.

data.title: Very rude host.
data.text: Just asked a general question on the phone and the response was arrogant and condescending.  That should have warned us not to go!  Very rude and unwelcoming.

data.title: Are you kidding me!
data.text: I parked at a meter and noticed none of the other cars had time on there meters. so I went in and asked the greeter about the parking. He assured me, "your good", that the parking is free at this piont in the day. We were the only people in the restraunt. We sit down, all eleven of us, eat dinner. The food was a little bland, but the waiters seemed very awkward. I let, got to my car an noted I had a parking ticket. I headed back in the restraunt to remind the greeter. He completely ignored me and walked away. I left and called to talke to the owner. The person that awnsered the phone was a completed jerk and hung up on me. All I wanted was a appalogy.

data.title: Are you kidding me??????????
data.text:
We attended a birthday BRUNCH (key word here is BRUNCH) here this past Sunday.....I will never go again.  

1)  After waiting for over 30 minutes for a server, when we finally got one, 18 people want a Mimosa (remember the Brunch word??) - they have NO champagne!!  What??? Mimosas are on their  brunch menu.   One of the attendees had bought a case of champagne for the guest of honor which they then had opened to create the Mimosas.  The restaurant, who could not accomodate the request for the drinks, then had the gall to charge $10 per bottle to uncork them!!  Wow!!  Are you kidding me????

2) A gentlemen at our table ordered an omelette to be made with asparagus -- ooops, guess what, they didn't have that either!!  They substituted spinich, he ate it, but again....  Are yoiu kidding me??  

3) My meal was ordered based on the recommendation of our waiter (oh, btw, there was only one for this large group), a shrimp and pasta dish.  Shrimp was tough and tasted like it had been cooked last week, pasta was dry with very little sauce and what there was of it was not good at all.  Are you kidding me???  This was a restaurant recommendation!!!

data.title: RACIST
data.text: Similar experience to the previous one titled "This place is a hostile racial place".  Greater had puzzled look about reservations even though the restaurant was practically completely empty. Rude, pompous greeter. Welcomed the next customers with a handshake and a smile. SHADY place. DO NOT GO.

data.title: This place is a hostile racial place
data.text:
Apparently, the owner/manager was the host today.  He asked if we had reservations, when
the entire place was empty.  I gave him a puzzled look, then he said it would be a 20 to 30 minute wait.  When, we questioned why we had to wait, he made up another excuse.  Then, started shouting at us.  We left, and told him we are going to report him to the Pasadena Chamber of Commerce.  DO NOT GO HERE!

data.title: wow.
data.text:
I have been going to Holly bar and grill for years with my wife. When we went last weekend I found the name had changed and I was absolutely blown away with the new Menu and atmosphere.  definitely  one of the best restaurants in Los angles county. 

Tony Alhilo

data.title: This place isn't Holly Strett
data.text:
We made a reservation here for 7p on a Friday night.   Upon arrival there was a large and loud party in the back of the restaurant and no other customers.   It was empty, large, a bit chilly and very uninviting.

We open the menu to only find this is an Armenian restaurant:  grape leaves, olives, lamb, hummis . . . and all kinds of odd, "poor people" food.

Service was great and ALL the personnel here are nice, warm and friendly.   That is the good part, the only good part.

Ambiance is non-existent, the few people there are on the loud/rough side, the place is cold (for some reason), the 3 hispanic cooks have no idea how to prepare Armenian food.

My wife had ravioli and I had a filet mignon . . . the only dishes on the menu we recognized.    Both were B, average to above average but not great.   Ordered my steak medium and it was almost raw (not rare).      We just paid the tab, left 25% for the good service and wished we had eaten some place else for $125.     

Will not go back here.   Nothing going for it, pricey and odd / average menu.  

Come back Holly Street Bar & Grille!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: No in Pasadena, Calif.
data.text:
My friends and I used to go to Holly Street Bar and Grill on a regular basis. Great service, food & live fun entertainment. 
Recently we decided to meet there..I was terribly disappointed to see it - Empty!  The whole decor is changed, besides the name. Eden? Why did they change the name thats been successful so long? NO ENTERTAINMENT! at all..
No one was in inside except the people who worked there. 
We ate outside & the food was great as usual. 
Our waiter Abel was gracious & fab. 
I don't think I want to return.It made me so sad to see it so changed.
Anonymous Guest.

data.title: This place feels established in Pasadena and has it's own identity and regulars.  Their highlight is not the food as...
data.text: This place feels established in Pasadena and has it's own identity and regulars.  Their highlight is not the food as much as the live music, but I've never eaten anything bad here.  Love the location with a great view of the lit up court house and gold line a stones throw away.  Great Jazz under the stars.
